Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - NoProfile

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Blocks all a specific user's actions on a system. This is a decent containment method.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Block Specific User's Actions

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers due to an entry of a debugger with no purpose of "debugging", but rather to run another program instead (likely something malicious). If you see this, then in most cases (95%), it's because of malware has set this as this is a common approach they use.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Image File Execution Option Additions (Registry)

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Checks for common places used for persistence in the Registry

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Registry Persistence

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on a specific user executing, renaming, writing, deleting, reading, or creating a file. This a way to track a user's movement in using HIPs. This is a good rule to apply to privileged accounts.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Track a User's Actions

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - File

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Hidden Powershell Detected

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Mounted Drives Exception

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
+SigRule#1
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on anything executed in the Temp directory.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Program Execution from Temp Folder

EPOPolicySettings.name: Windows:VMware Workstation Core Envelope - File Modification:1ca604de-8cd7-4669-acc4-da728a1d1bb9
EPOPolicySettings.param_str: VMware Workstation Core Envelope - File Modification

Setting.name: +AppDescription#0
Setting.value: VMWARE WORKSTATION

Setting.name: +AppPath#0
Setting.value: C:\PROGRAM FILES (X86)\VMWARE\VMWARE WORKSTATION\VMWARE.EXE

Setting.name: +AppSigner#0
Setting.value: CN="VMWARE, INC.", OU=DIGITAL ID CLASS 3 - MICROSOFT SOFTWARE VALIDATION V2, O="VMWARE, INC.", L=PALO ALTO, ST=CALIFORNIA, C=US

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: VMware Workstation Core Envelope - File Modification

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value:
Triggers on the following DLLs being written to disk, which could signal a UAC bypass in progress.
CRYPTBASE.dll SHCORE.dll WDSCORE.dll ACTIONQUEUE.dll NTWDBLIB.dll ELSEXT.dll DEVOBJ.dll

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __UAC Bypass

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on removable media being attached to the system. Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is a better fit for this but in the absence of it, this will do the job.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Removable Media

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Generic Application Invocation Protection

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Hits on a specific program with a specific hash.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Program Execution with a Specific Hash

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on a system changing its NTP server setting in the Registry. By default, domain joined systems will use the DC as their time source (Type: NT5DS). Workgroup systems use the Internet (Type: NTP).

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __NTP Server Change (Registry)

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Execution Policy Bypass in Powershell

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Hits whenever RDP has been invoked. We use the calling of mstsc.exe as the indicator.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __RDP Invoked

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on any Service Startup Mode changes.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Service Startup Mode change

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Hits on unsigned a Target Executable executing on the filesystem. For example, If you use Windows Explorer (explorer.exe) to open Notepad (notepad.exe), explorer.exe is the Executable while notepad.exe is the Target Executable.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Unsigned Target Executable Execution Anywhere

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - NonInteractive

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - Command

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value:
Typically used in the MiTRE ATT&CK matrix for persistence and Privilege Escalation
The Windows Accessibility Features are tools in Windows that allow users, especially those with disabilities, to have an easier experience. They consist of features like:
- Magnifier - On Screen Keyboard - Narrator (text-to-speech) - Personalization (Changing default colors and sounds) - Default text size - Speech Recognition - Sticky Keys
There are vulnerabilities associated with these features, although they mostly exist in older Windows versions, and generally require physical or Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) access.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Accessibility Feature Alteration

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Generic Application Hooking Protection

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on a specific program execution with the exception of a specified user.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Program Execution with the Execption of a Specific User

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on any application execution on the system, which is stored in C:\Windows\Prefetch.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Prefetch Addition

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on UAC being disabled in the Registry.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Disabled UAC (Registry)

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - EncodedCommand

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Powershell Command Restriction - NoLogo

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Double File Extension Execution

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Hits on unsigned .exe executing within System32

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Unsigned Target Executable Execution in C:\Windows\*

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Application Hooking

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Application Hooking

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on the Remote Registry Service being started

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Remote Registry Service Started

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Mimikatz usage

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on any drives being mounted.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Mounted Drives

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on a specific program anywhere on the system being written to disk, deleted, or renamed.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Program downloaded, deleted, or renamed anywhere on System

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on UAC being invoked.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __UAC Invoked

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Triggers on a new service being created

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __New Service Created

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
+SigRule#1
+SigRule#2
Setting.value: Rule { tag "Temp Folder Protection" Class Program Id 4078 level 0 Target_Executable { Include { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.bat" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.bat" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.dll" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.dll" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.exe" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.exe" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.js&" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.js" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.ps&" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.ps&" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&\\&.vb&" } \ { -path "C:\\Users\\&\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\&.vb&" } } Target_Executable { Exclude { -path "*\\&" } } directives program:open_with_create_thread program:run }

Setting.name: Description
Setting.value: Triggers on anything executed in the Temp directory.

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Open Files from Temp Folder

Setting.name: +SigRule#0
Description
Setting.value: Hits on unsigned Executable executing on the filesystem. For example, If you use Windows Explorer (explorer.exe) to open Notepad (notepad.exe), explorer.exe is the Executable while notepad.exe is the Target_Executable

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: __Unsigned Executable Execution Anywhere

Setting.name: Name
Setting.value: Access Protection - Prevent all programs from running files from the Temp folder
